an7.23:4.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, on the Vulture’s Peak Mountain.
an7.23:4.3: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:
an7.23:4.4: “Licchavis, I will teach you these seven principles that ensure you don’t decline.
an7.23:4.5: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.
an7.23:5.1: “And what are the seven principles that ensure you don’t decline?
an7.23:5.2: As long as the mendicants meet frequently and have many meetings,
an7.23:5.3: they can expect growth, not decline.
an7.23:6.1: As long as the mendicants meet in harmony, leave in harmony, and carry on their business in harmony,
an7.23:6.2: they can expect growth, not decline.
an7.23:7.1: As long as the mendicants don’t make new decrees or abolish existing decrees, but undertake and follow the ancient Vajjian principles as they have been decreed,
an7.23:7.2: they can expect growth, not decline.
an7.23:8.1: As long as the mendicants honor, respect, esteem, and venerate the senior mendicants—of long standing, long gone forth, fathers and leaders of the Saṅgha—and think them worth listening to,
an7.23:8.2: they can expect growth, not decline.
an7.23:9.1: As long as the mendicants don’t fall under the sway of arisen craving for future lives,
an7.23:9.2: they can expect growth, not decline.
an7.23:10.1: As long as the mendicants take care to live in wilderness lodgings,
an7.23:10.2: they can expect growth, not decline.
an7.23:11.1: As long as the mendicants individually establish mindfulness, so that
an7.23:11.2: more good-hearted spiritual companions might come, and those that have already come may live comfortably.
an7.23:11.3: they can expect growth, not decline.
an7.23:12.1: As long as these seven principles that ensure you don’t decline last among the mendicants, and as long as the mendicants are seen following them,
an7.23:12.2: they can expect growth, not decline.”
